p: Seasonal influenza epidemics, representing severe infectious diseases, are characterized by the widespread incidence of various symptoms such as a sudden onset of fever, cough, headache, and muscle and joint pain. The World Health Organization (WHO) reported that 3–5 million cases of severe illness occur worldwide each year because of seasonal influenza, leading to approximately 290,000—650,000 deaths annually [ 1]. Seasonal influenza also affects the economic productivity because of employee absence and unexpected increases in hospital work loads [ 2]. Prediction of influenza outbreaks is therefore crucially important to support real-time decision-making related to the management of hospital resources with a rapid response.
